item.title: # PIP 41 - Enable Direct POL Emissions to StakeManager.sol
item.dc:creator: H_Rook
item.description:
PIP 41 - Enable Direct POL Emissions to StakeManager.sol

Authors:

Simon Dosch, Harry Rook

Type: Contracts

Table of Contents:

  • Abstract
  • Motivation
  • Specification
  • Security Considerations
  • Backward Compatibility

Abstract

Currently, to support validator rewards on the Polygon PoS network, a StakeManager contract is used to facilitate distribution in accordance with the MATIC issuance schedule.

In order to maintain compatibility in the short term, the POL token EmissionManager.sol contract was set up in such a way that POL would be un-migrated to MATIC before being sent to the StakeManager.

Motivation

This proposed change will remove the un-migration of POL to MATIC in the EmissionManager.sol contract, allowing for the direct transfer of newly minted POL to the StakeManager contract.

Specification

The proposed upgrade does not require a large change in the current codebase and can be achieved via two lines of code in the EmissionManager.sol contract.

Current:

// backconvert POL to MATIC before sending to StakeManager

migration.unmigrateTo(stakeManager, stakeManagerAmt);

Would be replaced with:

_token.safeTransfer(stakeManager, stakeManagerAmt);

Backward Compatibility

The change will require a timely upgrade to the StakeManager.sol contract to fully support POL, so that stakers can also withdraw POL.

Security Considerations

The change in code is not complex, however, due to the importance of the POL contracts within the network, both an internal, as well as an external audit were done to ensure the security of the implementation.

Copyright

All copyrights and related rights in this work are waived under CC0 1.0 Universal.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: PIP-40: Support for Community Treasury Contracts
item.dc:creator: Mateusz
item.description:
PIP-40: Support for Community Treasury Contracts

Authors:

Simon Dosch, Mateusz Rzeszowski

Type: Contracts

Table of Contents:

  • Abstract
  • Motivation
  • Specification
  • Security Considerations
  • Backward Compatibility

Abstract

The POL Default Emission Manager specifies that a 1% annual compounding emission is directed to the Community Treasury.

Upon the deployment of POL contracts introduced in PIP-17, a multi-signature wallet (0x2ff25495d77f380d5F65B95F103181aE8b1cf898) was used to safeguard the funds until Community Board supervision is enacted.

PFP-2 now specifies the proposed implementation for the Community Treasury Board, including the use of Governor Bravo contracts to govern the Community Treasury funding allocation process.

This proposal will require a migration away from the current setup and, therefore, an upgrade to the Default Emission Manager via the Protocol Council.

Specification

We propose to upgrade the Default Emission Manager contract treasury address to the new Community Treasury Contract (0x86380e136a3aad5677a210ad02713694c4e6a5b9).

The particulars of the new Community Treasury Board governance can be found in PFP-2, with the key technical details shown below.

A new governance contract (Aragon) is proposed that will govern the Community Treasury.

A non-upgradeable OpenZeppelin ERC20Votes will be used as a voting token held by two SAFE contracts. Transfers, Approvals and Delegation will be disabled and tokens will be distributed upon contract deployment. Two roles are furthermore distinguished, Proposer and Executor.

  • 50.00000001 tokens will be distributed to the Proposer SAFE (0x2ff25495d77f380d5F65B95F103181aE8b1cf898) wallet operated by Polygon Labs,
  • 49.99999999 tokens will be distributed to the Executor ⅗ consensus multisig wallet (0xb7b02DbC9D054A8BA90b2172B4f8d2D79aC7d3a0) operated by the Community Treasury Board.

The Proposer is responsible for proposal creation, with 50 votes being the requirement.

Once a proposal has been created, both the PROPOSER and EXECUTOR’s yes votes are necessary to execute a proposal, with 100 votes being the required consensus.

The above setup ensures that while Polygon Labs may assist the Community Treasury Board with day-to-day administrative and other non-managerial operations, it may not execute any transactions, including the distribution of funds, without the CTB’s on-chain approval.

Backward Compatibility

This change is not backwards compatible with the current implementation of the Default Emissions Manger and will require a contract upgrade.

Security Considerations

The updated governing contracts for the treasury address utilize Aragon, which has been extensively tested and audited.

Copyright

All copyrights and related rights in this work are waived under CC0 1.0 Universal.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: Issue with Bor on Polygon Full Node: "local keystore not used" Error
item.dc:creator: d3v31oper
item.description:
Hello everyone,

I’ve set up a PoS Polygon full node. Heimdall is running successfully, but I’m having an issue with Bor. I’ve added “personal” to the [jsonrpc.http] API in Bor config.toml like this:

port = 8545
host = "0.0.0.0"
api = ["eth", "net", "web3", "txpool", "bor", "personal"]

However, I’m encountering an error in the logs that says: “local keystore not used.” ( I’ve created a keystore directory and set it’s path in config.toml. )

bor account new works fine, but "local keystore not used" appears when I try to create accounts via RPC and IPC.

Can anyone help me troubleshoot this? I’m happy to provide more information if needed.

Thanks!

Log Details :

WARN [06-22|05:16:48.815] Enabling deprecated personal namespace 
Welcome to the Geth JavaScript console!

instance: bor/v1.3.3/linux-amd64/go1.22.3
datadir: /var/lib/bor/data
modules: admin:1.0 bor:1.0 debug:1.0 eth:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 rpc:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0

To exit, press ctrl-d or type exit
> personal.newAccount
function github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/internal/jsre.MakeCallback.func1()
>  personal.newAccount("password")
GoError: Error: local keystore not used at InvalidResponse (web3.js:3143:16(29))
        at github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/internal/jsre.MakeCallback.func1 (native)
        at <eval>:1:20(3)

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: This is me | My introduction
item.dc:creator: Bisbille
item.description:
Basic Introduction:
My name’s Bisbille, from France. i’m a web developper and would love to contribute to this space as a web3 dev.

Current Projects:
I am currently working on several Web3 projects, including a decentralized application (dApp) for secure document verification using blockchain technology. Additionally, I am developing a smart contract-based system for managing supply chain transparency.

How can the community support your projects?
The community can support my projects by providing feedback, testing the applications, and sharing insights on best practices for security and scalability in Web3. I am also open to collaborations with other developers, designers, and blockchain enthusiasts to enhance the functionality and user experience of my projects.

Learning and Development:
Challenges faced: One of the main challenges I’ve encountered in the Web3 space is understanding the intricacies of smart contract security. To overcome this, I’ve engaged in numerous online courses, participated in hackathons, and sought mentorship from experienced developers.
Resources and learning paths: I highly recommend the ConsenSys Academy and the Ethereum Developer Portal for anyone looking to deepen their knowledge in Web3. These resources have been invaluable in my journey.

Community Engagement:
Contributing to the Polygon Labs community: I envision contributing by sharing my experiences and knowledge through blog posts, participating in forums, and helping newcomers navigate the complexities of Web3.
Participating in discussions, events, or initiatives: I am looking forward to participating in hackathons, webinars, and community meetups hosted by Polygon Labs. These events are great opportunities to learn, share, and grow together.

Future Aspirations:
Long-term goals: My long-term goal is to become a leading expert in blockchain technology and to develop innovative solutions that leverage the power of decentralized systems to solve real-world problems.
Future of blockchain: I see the future of blockchain as a cornerstone of digital trust and transparency. I hope to play a significant role in making blockchain technology more accessible and user-friendly for a broader audience.

Fun Facts:
Fun fact: Outside of Web3, I am an avid hiker and love exploring the French countryside. I also enjoy cooking and experimenting with new recipes in my free time.
Additional information: I am passionate about open-source projects and often contribute to various repositories on GitHub. I believe in the power of collaboration and community-driven development.

Connect and Collaborate:
Reaching out: Other community members can reach out to me via LinkedIn or Twitter for collaborations or discussions.
Looking for: I am looking for feedback on my current projects, potential partners for new initiatives, and resources to stay updated with the latest developments in Web3 technology.

item.title: Hola, aca Tylor desde Argentina
item.dc:creator: tetoese
item.description:
What’s your name (or username), and where are you from?

  • Hola, mi nombre es Tylor y soy de Buenos Aires, Argentina.

What drew you to the world of blockchain and Web3?

  • Me atrajo el potencial de la tecnología blockchain para descentralizar procesos y darle más poder a los usuarios sobre sus propios datos y activos.

Professional Background: Please share a bit about your professional background and current occupation.

  • Soy desarrollador de software con más de 10 años de experiencia. Actualmente trabajo como desarrollador full-stack en una startup tecnológica.

How do you see your skills and experiences contributing to your Web3 journey?

  • Mis habilidades en desarrollo de aplicaciones web y móviles, así como mi experiencia en trabajar con tecnologías descentralizadas, me permiten contribuir de manera efectiva en proyectos Web3, creando soluciones innovadoras y seguras.

Interests in Web3: What specific areas of Web3 are you most passionate about (e.g., DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, Gaming)?

  • Me apasionan los NFTs y los DAOs porque ofrecen nuevas formas de propiedad y gobernanza descentralizada. También me interesa DeFi por su capacidad de democratizar el acceso a servicios financieros.

Are there any projects or technologies in Web3 that you find particularly exciting or innovative?

  • Me entusiasman proyectos como Uniswap y Aave en el ámbito DeFi, y plataformas como OpenSea para la creación e intercambio de NFTs. También encuentro muy innovador el desarrollo de Polkadot por su enfoque en la interoperabilidad entre cadenas.

Feature Recommendations: Have you or a friend ever experienced any pain points when using Polygon PoS? Or, do you have any exciting ideas for the chain you would like to voice?

  • Algunas veces he experimentado congestión en la red y tiempos de espera prolongados.

If so, do you have any specific features/solutions you think would work well?

  • Sería útil implementar soluciones de escalabilidad adicionales y mejorar la UX para que sea más intuitiva para nuevos usuarios.

Current Projects: Are you currently working on any Web3 projects? If so, please briefly overview what you’re working on.

  • Actualmente estoy trabajando en un proyecto de NFT que busca tokenizar arte digital de artistas emergentes de América Latina, facilitando su acceso a un mercado global.

How can the community support your projects? Are there specific collaborations or insights you’re seeking?

  • La comunidad puede apoyar difundiendo el proyecto y participando en las primeras fases de prueba. También busco colaboradores con experiencia en marketing digital y desarrolladores interesados en el arte y los NFTs.

Learning and Development: What challenges have you faced in the Web3 space, and how have you overcome them?

  • El principal desafío ha sido la rápida evolución de la tecnología y la necesidad constante de aprender nuevas herramientas y lenguajes. Lo he superado dedicando tiempo semanalmente a estudiar y participar en comunidades y foros especializados.

Are there any resources or learning paths you’ve found invaluable in your Web3 education that you’d like to share?

  • Recursos como CryptoZombies, los cursos de ConsenSys Academy y la documentación de Ethereum han sido fundamentales para mi formación. También recomiendo seguir a líderes de opinión en Twitter y participar en webinars y conferencias.

Community Engagement: How do you envision contributing to the Polygon Labs community?

  • Me gustaría contribuir compartiendo mis experiencias y conocimientos a través de artículos, tutoriales y participando en discusiones técnicas. También estoy interesado en colaborar en proyectos open-source.

Are you looking forward to participating in any discussions, events, or initiatives?

  • Sí, estoy ansioso por participar en hackatones, meetups y conferencias que fomenten la colaboración y el intercambio de conocimientos dentro de la comunidad Web3.

Future Aspirations: What are your long-term goals within Web3 and blockchain technology?

  • Mis objetivos a largo plazo incluyen desarrollar soluciones que puedan impactar positivamente en la sociedad, mejorar la adopción de blockchain en diversas industrias y contribuir a la creación de un ecosistema descentralizado y justo.

How do you see the future of blockchain evolving, and what role do you hope to play in it?

  • Veo un futuro donde blockchain será parte integral de nuestra vida cotidiana, desde la gestión de identidades hasta el comercio y la gobernanza. Espero ser un facilitador de esta transición, creando tecnologías accesibles y seguras.

Fun Facts: Share a fun fact about yourself or your hobbies outside of Web3.

  • Además de la tecnología, me encanta la música y toco la guitarra en una banda local. También disfruto de los videojuegos y el trekking.

Is there anything else you’d like the community to know about you?

  • Estoy siempre abierto a aprender y colaborar en nuevos proyectos. Me motiva la innovación y el impacto positivo que podemos lograr juntos en la comunidad Web3.

Connect and Collaborate: How can other community members reach out to you for collaborations or discussions?

  • Pueden contactarme a través de mi perfil en LinkedIn o enviarme un mensaje en Twitter @JuanPerezDev.

Are you looking for feedback, partners, or resources for your projects?

  • Sí, estoy buscando feedback sobre mi proyecto de NFT, así como posibles socios y recursos para escalar la plataforma y llegar a más artistas y coleccionistas.

1 post - 1 participant

item.title: hi, this is my presentation :)
item.dc:creator: riactians
item.description:
What’s your name (or username), and where are you from?

  • My name is Taylor

What drew you to the world of blockchain and Web3?

  • The potential for decentralized technologies to revolutionize the music industry and empower artists with more control over their work and earnings intrigued me. Web3 offers exciting new ways to engage with fans and create unique, immutable experiences through NFTs and other innovations.

Professional Background: Please share a bit about your professional background and current occupation.

  • I am a singer-songwriter and musician with over a decade of experience in the music industry. I’ve released multiple albums and have been involved in various aspects of music production and distribution.

How do you see your skills and experiences contributing to your Web3 journey?

  • My background in music and my understanding of the industry’s challenges give me a unique perspective on how Web3 can address issues like artist compensation and fan engagement. I can leverage my platform to educate and advocate for Web3 adoption in the entertainment industry.

Interests in Web3: What specific areas of Web3 are you most passionate about (e.g., DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, Gaming)?

  • I am most passionate about NFTs and DAOs. NFTs offer a new way to create and sell digital collectibles and exclusive content, while DAOs provide a decentralized approach to managing creative projects and fan communities.

Are there any projects or technologies in Web3 that you find particularly exciting or innovative?

  • Projects like Audius, which is a decentralized music streaming service, and platforms like Rarible and OpenSea, which facilitate the creation and sale of NFTs, are particularly exciting. They represent the future of how artists can interact with their audience and monetize their work directly.

Feature Recommendations: Have you or a friend ever experienced any pain points when using Polygon PoS? Or, do you have any exciting ideas for the chain you would like to voice?

  • Some challenges include the complexity of onboarding new users and occasional network congestion. Simplifying the user interface and improving scalability could enhance the user experience.

If so, do you have any specific features/solutions you think would work well?

  • Implementing more user-friendly interfaces and providing comprehensive educational resources for newcomers would be beneficial. Additionally, exploring layer-2 solutions or other scaling technologies could help mitigate network congestion issues.

Current Projects: Are you currently working on any Web3 projects? If so, please briefly overview what you’re working on.

  • I’m exploring the creation of an NFT collection that offers exclusive content, such as unreleased songs, behind-the-scenes footage, and unique artwork. Additionally, I’m considering launching a DAO to engage fans in the decision-making process for future projects.

How can the community support your projects? Are there specific collaborations or insights you’re seeking?

  • The community can support by providing feedback on the NFT collection and participating in the DAO once it’s launched. Insights from other artists and developers experienced in Web3 would be invaluable.

Learning and Development: What challenges have you faced in the Web3 space, and how have you overcome them?

  • Navigating the technical aspects of blockchain technology has been challenging. I’ve overcome this by collaborating with knowledgeable developers and continuously educating myself through online courses and community forums.

Are there any resources or learning paths you’ve found invaluable in your Web3 education that you’d like to share?

  • Resources like ConsenSys Academy, CryptoZombies, and the Ethereum documentation have been incredibly helpful. Participating in online communities and attending virtual meetups have also provided valuable insights.

Community Engagement: How do you envision contributing to the Polygon Labs community?

  • I plan to contribute by sharing my journey and experiences, advocating for artist empowerment through Web3, and collaborating on initiatives that bridge the gap between the music industry and blockchain technology.

Are you looking forward to participating in any discussions, events, or initiatives?

  • Yes, I’m excited to participate in discussions and events that focus on the intersection of music and blockchain, and I’m eager to learn from and collaborate with others in the community.

Future Aspirations: What are your long-term goals within Web3 and blockchain technology?

  • My long-term goals include creating sustainable revenue streams for artists through blockchain technology, fostering closer connections between artists and fans, and contributing to the development of decentralized platforms that prioritize artist rights and fair compensation.

How do you see the future of blockchain evolving, and what role do you hope to play in it?

  • I see blockchain evolving to become more user-friendly and widely adopted across various industries. I hope to play a role in advocating for and implementing blockchain solutions that empower creators and disrupt traditional models in the entertainment industry.

Fun Facts: Share a fun fact about yourself or your hobbies outside of Web3.

  • Outside of my music career, I’m passionate about baking and often experiment with new recipes. I also love hiking and spending time in nature.

Is there anything else you’d like the community to know about you?

  • I’m committed to learning and growing within the Web3 space, and I’m excited to explore how blockchain can transform the music industry and beyond.

Connect and Collaborate: How can other community members reach out to you for collaborations or discussions?

item.title: New guy arrived and introduce myself.
item.dc:creator: alexj
item.description:
Basic Introduction:
What’s your name (or username), and where are you from?
Hi, My name is AlexJ, come from China.
What drew you to the world of blockchain and Web3?
The eth and btc paper.

Professional Background:
Please share a bit about your professional background and current occupation.
I am QA in a blockchain wallet company.
How do you see your skills and experiences contributing to your Web3 journey?
As a QA professional, my skills and experiences contribute to my Web3 journey in several ways:

  1. Attention to Detail: My meticulous nature ensures that I catch even the smallest bugs and inconsistencies, which is crucial in the rapidly evolving Web3 space where precision is key.
  2. Analytical Skills: My ability to analyze complex systems and processes helps in understanding and testing decentralized applications (dApps) and smart contracts effectively.
  3. Adaptability: The Web3 ecosystem is constantly changing, and my experience in adapting to new technologies and methodologies allows me to stay ahead and ensure quality in innovative environments.
  4. Problem-Solving: My experience in identifying, diagnosing, and resolving issues ensures that I can help maintain the robustness and reliability of Web3 applications.
  5. Communication: Effective communication with developers and other stakeholders is essential in ensuring that quality standards are met, and my experience in this area helps bridge any gaps.
    Overall, my QA background equips me with the necessary tools to contribute significantly to the quality and reliability of Web3 projects.

Interests in Web3:
What specific areas of Web3 are you most passionate about (e.g., DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, Gaming)?
DeFi.
Are there any projects or technologies in Web3 that you find particularly exciting or innovative?
Polygon evm and the L2 field.

item.title: "Introduce Yourself" b.hasbay
item.dc:creator: arbgainer
item.description:
Berkay Hasbay

Creative and detail-oriented Video Editor and Animator with a rich background in cinema and digital communication, seeking to leverage extensive experience in video production and a deep understanding of the crypto industry to produce compelling, engaging content for Token Metrics.

Education
Ph.D. in Communication Sciences (Ongoing)
Istinye University
Research Focus: Effective community engagement and decentralized communication

M.A. in Cinema
Işık University
Specialization: Digital communication

Professional Experience
Director | Various Projects (2017-2020)

  • Directed commercials, short-feature movies, and music videos, ensuring artistic and technical excellence.
  • Managed and led diverse teams, optimizing collaboration and project outcomes.
  • Recipient of multiple international and national awards for filmmaking excellence.

Creative Director | Akıllı Baykuş (2019-2020)

  • Led a team of designers, writers, and marketers in the creation of engaging online courses and content.
  • Strategically managed significant budgets for paid ads campaigns across multiple digital platforms.
  • Utilized analytics to enhance user engagement and platform functionality.

DeFi and Crypto Trader & Researcher (Since 2022)

  • In-depth analysis and research of market trends and DeFi protocols.
  • Active contributor to crypto community discussions and educational content via social media and blogs.

Key Skills

  • Video Production: Expert in Adobe Premiere, After Effects, and Final Cut. Proficient in creating seamless video content from concept to final output.
  • Animation and Special Effects: Skilled in creating engaging animations and applying special effects to enhance visual storytelling.
  • Digital Communication: Strong background in managing digital content and community engagement strategies.
  • Crypto Industry Knowledge: Deep understanding of blockchain technology, DeFi, and crypto market dynamics.

Additional Qualifications

  • Onchain User Expertise: Proficient in navigating and optimizing user interactions within decentralized platforms.

Professional Affiliations

  • Member of various online crypto communities and forums.
  • Active participant in blockchain and digital media conferences
